definition: to have a connection with/to be close (to reality)/to be relevant/to have one's hand in
variant of 沾[zhan1]/to moisten
to moisten/to be infected by/to receive benefit or advantage through a contact/to touch
suffix of a noun of locality
side/edge/margin/border/boundary/CL:個|个[ge4]/simultaneously

sentences.english: If you’re studying languages, it doesn’t even come close.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在学习一门语言，还是和它不沾边。

sentences.english: They're never anything to do with science.
sentences.chinese: 那里的人从来不谈论和科学沾边儿的事情。

sentences.english: Until then I've been bored by everythellong associated with English courses.
sentences.chinese: 在这以前，我对于所有跟英文课沾边的事都感应腻味。

sentences.english: This style of development doesn't jive with the concept of shared services.
sentences.chinese: 这种风格的开发与共享服务的概念一点也不沾边。

sentences.english: Nobody in the company had done anything 3D.
sentences.chinese: 公司里没有任何人干过与3D沾边的活。

sentences.english: Until then I'd been bored by everything associated with English courses.
sentences.chinese: 在这之前，我对所有跟英文课沾边的事感到腻味。

sentences.english: I didn’t want to go into the retail business. I hated it.
sentences.chinese: 我压根就不想跟零售业沾边，厌恶至极。

definition: to keep close to the edge/near the mark/close to (the true figure)/relevant (used with negative to mean totally irrelevant)
to equate/to consider (two things) to be equivalent

to match/in tune/reasonable
see 沒關係|没关系[mei2 guan1 xi5]
to be completely unrelated to one another (idiom)/irrelevant
pinyin: feng1 ma3 niu2 bu4 xiang1 ji2

definition: two quite different things/another kettle of fish
two kinds/difference
pronoun/synonym/byword
to disregard/to leave aside
popular/in demand/well regarded
to feel strongly about/to be fond of/obsession/deep commitment
always (previously)
(math.) equals sign =
to show respect from a distance (idiom)/to remain at a respectful distance
